title: Goblincon 5257 Rhineriver 2
content:
[[include :scp-wiki:theme:black-highlighter-theme]]

[[include :scp-wiki:component:bhl-dark-sidebar]]

[[include :scp-wiki:component:toggle-sidebar-bhl]]

[[include :scp-wiki:component:pride-highlighter |inc-bi= --]]]

[[include :scp-wiki:component:acs-animation]]

[[include :scp-wiki:component:anomaly-class-bar-source

    |item-number= 7749

    |clearance= 3

    |container-class= keter

    |secondary-class= none

    |disruption-class= ekhi

    |risk-class= critical

    ]]

-----

[[include component:image-block name=reno.png|align=center|width=100%|caption=Reno, Nevada, United States. Previously home to the main Site-86 complex.]]

-----

**Special Containment Procedures:** Until it can be definitively proven to be an isolated incident, SCP-7749 is to remain classified as a Keter-class anomaly. The grounds of the former Site-86 are to be cordoned off from civilian access and all witnesses to SCP-7749 have been amnesticized with the cover story of an intentional demolition administered.

Investigation into "SIMULACRUM" is ongoing.

**Description:** SCP-7749 was an anomalous event that occurred on May 25, 2023. SCP-7749 consisted of the sudden disappearance of General Purpose Site-86 from baseline reality, as well as all personnel and anomalies still contained within at the time of occurrence. The cause of SCP-7749 is unknown, though it is believed to be related to the anomaly known as SCP-7749-ARC (see archived file for further information), which was among the anomalies declared lost as a result of SCP-7749.

The regions of space that were previously occupied by Site-86 are unable to be entered by any individual. Individuals attempting to enter one of these areas will be stopped by an unseen physical barrier and will be met by a message written in text anomalously appearing in the air in front of them. This message has been included below:

[[div class="blockquote"]]
++ Please try again

Please try again - there was a problem fetching the simulation you requested.
Most probably you can just click ##blue|Reload## or Ctrl-R and the simulation will run as you expected.

If you are seeing a lot of these errors, SIMULACRUM may be under stress.

Thanks for visiting this simulation, and if you're one of our 1 000 000 players, for using SIMULACRUM for your simulation development project.

[[size 75%]]
{{ERROR CODE: DB200}}
[[/size]]
[[/div]]

Determining the cause of SCP-7749, as well as the significance of this "SIMULACRUM", are considered top-level priorities.
author: Rhineriver
